Patent Information.Patent Title: Selectively targeted antimicrobial peptides and the use thereof.
Patent Information.Abstract: The present invention relates to targeting peptides capable of specifically binding to microbial organisms (e.g., P. aeruginosa or S. mutans), antimicrobial peptides having antimicrobial activities, and specifically/selectively targeted antimicrobial peptides (STAMPs). In addition, the present invention provides methods of selectively killing or inhibiting microbial organisms by using the peptides or compositions provided by the present invention.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Antibacterial peptide PMAP-23 (Myeloid antibacterial peptide 23; pigs, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli ML35 (MIC=2 µM), Escherichia coli ATCC 25922 (MIC=4 µM), Salmonella typhimurium ATCC 14028 (MIC=8 µM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853 (MIC=16 µM).Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus megaterium (MIC=2 µM), Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC=4 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Function: Exerts antimicrobial activity against both Gram-positive and negative bacteria at concentrations of 2-16 micro molar. Its activity appears to be mediated by its ability to damage bacterial membranes.

Literature.Title: Molecular cloning and chemical synthesis of a novel antibacterial peptide derived from pig myeloid cells.
Literature.Author: Zanetti M, Storici P, Tossi A, Scocchi M, Gennaro R.
